heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 47.89mm with a maximum intensity of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 3 cold snaps; typically, 3.6 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest windy periods recorded.  This windy period is ranked 5th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 02 February 2026 and has lasted 4 days.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%) and rainfall (up 1.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 338 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 113 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 337.7m lower than yesterday, 112.9m lower than the past week, 111.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 530m minimum and 1993m maximum, with an average of 673.1m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 786.0m and 785.0m.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and little or no wind. Rain showers likely, fog or low cloud is expected, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
